member.name: T:Autofac.Extras.Quartz.AutofacJobFactory
member.summary: Resolve Quartz Job and it's dependencies from Autofac container.
member.remarks: Factory retuns wrapper around read job. It wraps job execution in nested lifetime scope.

member.name: M:Autofac.Extras.Quartz.AutofacJobFactory.#ctor(Autofac.ILifetimeScope,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The tag to use for new scopes.

member.name: M:Autofac.Extras.Quartz.AutofacJobFactory.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Autofac.Extras.Quartz.AutofacJobFactory.NewJob(Quartz.Spi.TriggerFiredBundle,Quartz.IScheduler)
member.summary: Called by the scheduler at the time of the trigger firing, in order to produce a instance on which to call Execute.
member.remarks: It should be extremely rare for this method to throw an exception - basically only the the case where there is no way at all to instantiate and prepare the Job for execution. When the exception is thrown, the Scheduler will move all triggers associated with the Job into the state, which will require human intervention (e.g. an application restart after fixing whatever configuration problem led to the issue wih instantiating the Job.
member.param: The TriggerFiredBundle from which the and other info relating to the trigger firing can be obtained.
a handle to the scheduler that is about to execute the job
member.throws: SchedulerException if there is a problem instantiating the Job.
member.exception: Error resolving exception. Original exception will be stored in .

member.name: M:Autofac.Extras.Quartz.AutofacJobFactory.ReturnJob(Quartz.IJob)
member.summary: Allows the the job factory to destroy/cleanup the job if needed.

See http://quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/configuration/ for settings description. for some configuration property names.
